conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the Ampere force received by the ν-shaped current-carrying wire.
The wire forms a ν shape with an included angle of 60° and each side has a length of l.
Only the segments parallel to the magnetic field will experience a force.
Both sides of the ν shape are parallel to the magnetic field.
The total length of the wire contributing to the force is 2l.
The magnetic force F on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = I · B · L · sin(θ).
For each segment of length l, F_segment = I · B · l · sin(90°) = I · B · l.
The total force from both segments is F_total = 2 · (I · B · l) = 2I · B · l.
The magnitude of the Ampere force received by the ν-shaped current-carrying wire is 2IBl.
